In Tucumán, Potenciar Trabajo includes previous beneficiaries of Argentina Trabaja and Ellas Hacen programs.', 'In 2020, in collaboration with the Ministry of Women, Gender, and Diversity of the Nation, 100 women experiencing violence were successfully enrolled in the Potenciar Trabajo program, thereby expanding its scope to address gender-related issues as well.']

Descripcion: El Programa Mujeres Autónomas, bajo la Secretaría de Estado de Las Mujeres, Géneros y Diversidad y la Dirección de Promoción y Protección de Derechos de Las Mujeres, Géneros y Diversidad, está dirigido por Florencia Carolina Villagra. El contacto es Piedras 530, 3er piso, teléfonos 0381 - 4310980 - 4311370, interno 325, y el sitio oficial es www.desarrollosocialtuc.gob.ar. Este programa tiene como objetivo general brindar apoyo para el empoderamiento económico y subjetivo de mujeres y personas de la diversidad en riesgo social en toda la provincia de Tucumán. Consiste en brindar apoyo económico, alimentario, materiales y mobiliarios a mujeres y diversidad que sufren situaciones de violencia, riesgo sanitario, desocupación y/o recursos insuficientes. La población destinataria incluye a todas las mujeres y personas de la diversidad que enfrentan estas condiciones en la provincia. El organismo responsable de la ejecución del programa es el Ministerio de Desarrollo Social de Tucumán. El programa comenzó a implementarse cuando le fue asignado presupuesto a la Secretaría y el apoyo alimentario se realiza a través de módulos alimentarios. En el año 2019 se brindaron un total de 1,300 asistencias y en el año 2020 un total de 1,850 asistencias, de las cuales 1,000 fueron alimentarias, 600 ayudas económicas, 100 entregas de herramientas de trabajo y 150 asistencias de mobiliario.
Traduccion: The Women Empowerment Program, under the Secretary of State for Women, Genders, and Diversity and the Directorate for Promotion and Protection of Women, Genders, and Diversity Rights, is led by Florencia Carolina Villagra. The contact information is at Piedras 530, 3rd floor, with phone numbers 0381-4310980 - 4311370, extension 325, and the official website is www.desarrollosocialtuc.gob.ar. This program aims to support the economic and subjective empowerment of women and individuals from diverse backgrounds facing social risks throughout the province of Tucumán. It provides economic, food, material, and furniture support to women and individuals from diverse backgrounds experiencing situations of violence, health risks, unemployment, and/or insufficient resources. The target population includes all women and diverse individuals facing these conditions in the province. The Ministry of Social Development of Tucumán is responsible for executing the program. The program began implementation upon allocation of budget to the Secretariat, and food support is provided through food modules. In 2019, a total of 1,300 supports were provided, and in 2020, a total of 1,850 supports were provided, including 1,000 food assists, 600 economic aids, 100 deliveries of work tools, and 150 furniture assists.

The contact information is at Piedras 530, 3rd floor, with phone numbers 0381-4310980 - 4311370, extension 325, and the official website is www.desarrollosocialtuc.gob.ar. In 2019, a total of 1,300 supports were provided, and in 2020, a total of 1,850 supports were provided, including 1,000 food assists, 600 economic aids, 100 deliveries of work tools, and 150 furniture assists.']

Descripcion:
El Programa Talleres de Verano, perteneciente a la Secretaría de Estado de Articulación Territorial y Desarrollo Local y dirigido por Rodrigo Azcuy, tiene como contacto Piedras 530, 3er piso, teléfonos 0381 - 4310980 - 4311370, interno 325, y el sitio oficial www.desarrollosocialtuc.gob.ar. Este programa busca generar espacios de contención mediante actividades lúdicas, recreativas y de apoyo escolar para niños y niñas en toda la provincia de Tucumán, especialmente durante el periodo estival. Sus objetivos específicos incluyen ofrecer espacios de contención para niños, niñas y adolescentes en zonas vulnerables a través de la gestión asociada entre las Mesas de Gestión Local y el Estado; ofrecer prácticas recreativas para niños, niñas y adolescentes en localidades con Mesas de Gestión Local; fortalecer las Organizaciones de la Sociedad Civil mediante procesos de gestión asociada con el Estado; optimizar el impacto de las acciones programáticas de la Secretaría de Articulación Territorial y Desarrollo Local a través de la articulación en el nivel local; y promover habilidades creativas de adaptación a la “nueva normalidad” para actividades recreativas en contextos de pandemia.

El programa se localiza en todo el territorio de Tucumán y se implementa a través de la ejecución de talleres de verano entre enero y febrero. Está destinado a todos los niños y niñas de la provincia, aunque en algunos casos también se orienta a adolescentes, jóvenes, adultos mayores e incluso a propuestas intergeneracionales, incluyendo pueblos originarios. Los talleres se llevan a cabo conjuntamente con gobiernos locales, escuelas, clubes deportivos, centros comunitarios y cooperativas, lo que también ayuda a mantener los comedores escolares en verano. Los recursos se ajustan a la realidad local y las características idiosincráticas de cada zona. En promedio, se financian 100 talleres para 100 niños y niñas. El organismo responsable de la ejecución del programa es el Ministerio de Desarrollo Social de Tucumán.
Traduccion:
The Summer Workshops Program, under the Secretary of State for Territorial Articulation and Local Development and directed by Rodrigo Azcuy, can be contacted at Piedras 530, 3rd floor, with phone numbers 0381-4310980 - 4311370, extension 325, and the official website www.desarrollosocialtuc.gob.ar. This program aims to create spaces of support through recreational, educational, and school support activities for children throughout the province of Tucumán, especially during the summer period.

Specific objectives include providing support spaces for children and adolescents in vulnerable areas through joint management between Local Management Tables and the State; offering recreational practices for children and adolescents in localities with Local Management Tables; strengthening Civil Society Organizations through joint management processes with the State; optimizing the impact of programmatic actions of the Secretary of Territorial Articulation and Local Development through local level coordination; and promoting creative adaptation skills to the "new normal" for recreational activities in pandemic contexts.

The program operates throughout the territory of Tucumán and is implemented through the execution of summer workshops between January and February. It is intended for all children in the province, with some activities also targeting adolescents, young people, the elderly, and even intergenerational proposals, including indigenous peoples. The workshops are conducted in collaboration with local governments, schools, sports clubs, community centers, and cooperatives, which also helps in maintaining school cafeterias during the summer. Resources are tailored to the local reality and idiosyncratic characteristics of each area. On average, 100 workshops are funded for 100 children.

The Ministry of Social Development of Tucumán is responsible for executing the program.
Parrafos: ['The Summer Workshops Program, under the Secretary of State for Territorial Articulation and Local Development and directed by Rodrigo Azcuy, can be contacted at Piedras 530, 3rd floor, with phone numbers 0381-4310980 - 4311370, extension 325, and the official website www.desarrollosocialtuc.gob.ar. This program aims to create spaces of support through recreational, educational, and school support activities for children throughout the province of Tucumán, especially during the summer period.', 'Specific objectives include providing support spaces for children and adolescents in vulnerable areas through joint management between Local Management Tables and the State; offering recreational practices for children and adolescents in localities with Local Management Tables; strengthening Civil Society Organizations through joint management processes with the State; optimizing the impact of programmatic actions of the Secretary of Territorial Articulation and Local Development through local level coordination; and promoting creative adaptation skills to the "new normal" for recreational activities in pandemic contexts.', 'The program operates throughout the territory of Tucumán and is implemented through the execution of summer workshops between January and February. It is intended for all children in the province, with some activities also targeting adolescents, young people, the elderly, and even intergenerational proposals, including indigenous peoples. The workshops are conducted in collaboration with local governments, schools, sports clubs, community centers, and cooperatives, which also helps in maintaining school cafeterias during the summer. Resources are tailored to the local reality and idiosyncratic characteristics of each area. On average, 100 workshops are funded for 100 children.', 'The Ministry of Social Development of Tucumán is responsible for executing the program.']

Programas: Centros de Primera Escucha y Orientación en Territorio
Descripcion:
El Programa de Centros de Primera Escucha y Orientación en Territorio, bajo la Secretaría de Estado de Políticas Integrales Sobre Adicciones y dirigido por Graciela Haydee Boscarino de Yalour, está ubicado en Piedras 530, 3er piso, con teléfonos 0381 - 4310980 - 4311370, interno 325, y su sitio oficial es www.desarrollosocialtuc.gob.ar. Su objetivo general es aumentar la accesibilidad y las puertas de entrada al Estado, generar estrategias comunitarias de promoción y asistencia integral, y contribuir al fortalecimiento de redes territoriales para promover el acceso a derechos de la comunidad. Específicamente, busca crear condiciones para que las personas accedan a la red de abordaje de los Centros de Atención Primaria de las Adicciones (CEPLA).

El programa se implementa en todo el territorio de Tucumán, con un equipo integral compuesto por psicólogas y trabajadoras sociales becadas por Nación. Estos equipos estarán en contacto permanente con organizaciones sociales y la población en general de los barrios, generando las condiciones para que las personas accedan a la red de abordaje de los CEPLA. Estos centros actúan como la puerta de entrada para aquellos que necesiten otros servicios del Ministerio y del Estado.

Destinado a toda la población de la provincia, el programa es ejecutado por el Ministerio de Desarrollo Social de Tucumán. En 2021, se pusieron en marcha cuatro centros ubicados en los barrios Alberdi Norte, Autopista Sur, 24 de septiembre y El Sifón.
Traduccion:
The Centers for First Listening and Orientation in Territory Program, under the Secretary of State for Comprehensive Addiction Policies and directed by Graciela Haydee Boscarino de Yalour, is located at Piedras 530, 3rd floor, with phone numbers 0381-4310980 - 4311370, extension 325, and its official website is www.desarrollosocialtuc.gob.ar. Its general objective is to increase accessibility and entry points to the State, generate community strategies for comprehensive promotion and assistance, and contribute to strengthening territorial networks to promote community access to rights. Specifically, it aims to create conditions for people to access the network of Primary Care Centers for Addictions (CEPLA).

The program is implemented throughout the territory of Tucumán, with a comprehensive team composed of psychologists and social workers funded by the Nation. These teams will be in permanent contact with social organizations and the general population of neighborhoods, creating conditions for people to access the CEPLA network. These centers act as the gateway for those who need other services from the Ministry and the State.

Targeted at the entire population of the province, the program is executed by the Ministry of Social Development of Tucumán. In 2021, four centers were launched located in the neighborhoods of Alberdi Norte, Autopista Sur, 24 de septiembre, and El Sifón.

Programas: Programa de Asistencia Integral a Víctimas de Trata de Personas
Descripcion:
El Programa de Asistencia Integral a Víctimas de Trata de Personas, gestionado por la Secretaría de Estado de Niñez, Adolescencia y Familia y dirigido por Bruno Rafael Medina, está ubicado en Piedras 530, 3er piso, con teléfonos 0381 - 4310980 - 4311370, interno 325. Su sitio oficial es www.desarrollosocialtuc.gob.ar. Su objetivo general es proporcionar información sobre los derechos que asisten a las víctimas de trata.

El programa se implementa en todo el territorio de la provincia de Tucumán y ofrece un abordaje integral, acompañamiento y asistencia material a las víctimas de trata y sus familias. Está destinado a todas las personas de la provincia y es ejecutado por el Ministerio de Desarrollo Social de Tucumán.
Traduccion:
The Comprehensive Assistance Program for Victims of Human Trafficking, managed by the Secretary of State for Childhood, Adolescence, and Family and directed by Bruno Rafael Medina, is located at Piedras 530, 3rd floor, with phone numbers 0381-4310980 - 4311370, extension 325. Its official website is www.desarrollosocialtuc.gob.ar. Its general objective is to provide information about the rights of victims of trafficking.

The program is implemented throughout the province of Tucumán and offers comprehensive approach, support, and material assistance to victims of trafficking and their families. It is aimed at all residents of the province and is executed by the Ministry of Social Development of Tucumán.

Programas: Programa de Acompañamiento Para el Egreso de Adolescentes y Jóvenes Sin Cuidados Parentales
Descripcion:
El Programa de Acompañamiento para el Egreso de Adolescentes y Jóvenes sin Cuidados Parentales es gestionado por la Secretaría de Estado de Niñez, Adolescencia y Familia, con la dirección de Cristian Omar Arroyo. Se encuentra en Piedras 530, 3er piso, y sus teléfonos son 0381 - 4310980 - 4311370, interno 325. El sitio oficial es www.desarrollosocialtuc.gob.ar. El objetivo general del programa es fortalecer el proyecto de vida de los jóvenes que egresan de los Dispositivos de Cuidados Institucionales.

Este programa se aplica en todo el territorio de la provincia de Tucumán y trabaja de forma conjunta e integrada en el acompañamiento de jóvenes que salen del sistema de protección, ayudándoles en la construcción de su proyecto de vida según la ley nacional N° 27364. Incluye el fortalecimiento y acompañamiento de un referente que los apoya en su inserción a la vida adulta y proporciona un incentivo económico para ayudarles con el alquiler y la alimentación. Está destinado a todas las personas jóvenes de la provincia y es ejecutado por el Ministerio de Desarrollo Social de Tucumán. La Ley Nacional de Egreso Asistido N° 27.364 fue aprobada en la provincia mediante resolución 900/19.
Traduccion:
The Accompaniment Program for the Transition of Adolescents and Young People without Parental Care is managed by the Secretary of State for Childhood, Adolescence, and Family, under the direction of Cristian Omar Arroyo. It is located at Piedras 530, 3rd floor, with telephone numbers 0381-4310980 - 4311370, extension 325. The official website is www.desarrollosocialtuc.gob.ar. The general objective of the program is to strengthen the life projects of young people who leave Institutional Care Devices.

This program is implemented throughout the province of Tucumán and works jointly and integrally in supporting young people exiting the protection system, helping them construct their life projects according to National Law No. 27,364. It includes strengthening and support from a mentor who assists them in their transition to adulthood, and provides an economic incentive to help with rent and food. It is aimed at all young people in the province and is executed by the Ministry of Social Development of Tucumán. The National Law on Assisted Transition No. 27,364 was adopted in the province through Resolution 900/19.

Programas: Programa de Salud Sexual y Reproductiva
Descripcion:
El Programa de Salud Sexual y Reproductiva, dirigido por la Dra. Graciela Lavado y perteneciente a la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica y la Dirección General del Programa Integrado de Salud, se ubica en 25 de mayo 90, con contacto en el teléfono 0381 - 4844000, internos 504/505 y el correo mij_ssyr@msptucuman.gov.ar. El objetivo general del programa es garantizar los derechos sexuales y reproductivos, reducir la mortalidad materna y perinatal, y disminuir la morbilidad perinatal.

El programa se enfoca en brindar herramientas teórico-prácticas al equipo de salud en todos los niveles de atención en salud sexual y reproductiva integral, reducción de riesgo y daño, y en fortalecer y crear nuevos espacios de consejería integral en salud sexual y reproductiva. Trabaja especialmente con la población adolescente para asegurar su acceso a la información y a la salud, empoderándolos como sujetos de derecho. También incorpora acciones de trabajo en diversidad sexual para garantizar los derechos del colectivo LGBTQ y contribuye al acceso integral de la salud de la población TRANS al Sistema de Salud Pública.

Continúa con el trabajo en salud reproductiva, afianza y consolida los mecanismos de provisión de insumos necesarios, y articula con distintos programas del PRIS y otros ministerios. Se fortalece la prevención y promoción de la salud sexual y el ZIKA, y se busca lograr un registro fidedigno y de calidad de las prestaciones de salud sexual de todos los efectores de la provincia, optimizando la informatización del programa. Además, se fortalece el trabajo de los equipos de salud sexual en las áreas operativas con su importante trabajo de terreno con la comunidad y la capacitación de los equipos de salud del programa.

La implementación de este programa se realiza en todo el territorio de la provincia de Tucumán, trabajando coordinadamente con el programa nacional de salud sexual y procreación responsable para garantizar el cumplimiento de los derechos sexuales y reproductivos de la población. Está destinado a todos los habitantes de la provincia y es ejecutado por el Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán.
Traduccion:
The Sexual and Reproductive Health Program, led by Dr. Graciela Lavado and belonging to the Executive Medical Secretary and the General Directorate of the Integrated Health Program, is located at 25 de Mayo 90. You can contact them at telephone number 0381-4844000, extensions 504/505, or via email at mij_ssyr@msptucuman.gov.ar. The program's overarching goal is to guarantee sexual and reproductive rights, reduce maternal and perinatal mortality, and decrease perinatal morbidity.

The program focuses on providing theoretical and practical tools to the healthcare team at all levels of comprehensive sexual and reproductive health care. It emphasizes risk and harm reduction and aims to strengthen and establish new comprehensive counseling spaces in sexual and reproductive health. Special attention is given to adolescents to ensure their access to information and healthcare, empowering them as rights holders. The program also incorporates actions focused on sexual diversity to safeguard the rights of LGBTQ+ communities and ensures comprehensive healthcare access for transgender individuals within the public health system.

Continuing its efforts in reproductive health, the program reinforces and consolidates the supply mechanisms of necessary supplies and collaborates with various programs of the PRIS and other ministries. It strengthens the prevention and promotion of sexual health and Zika prevention, aiming to achieve accurate and high-quality records of sexual health services across all healthcare providers in the province, optimizing program digitalization. Furthermore, it enhances the work of sexual health teams in operational areas through community fieldwork and the training of healthcare teams.

This program is implemented throughout the province of Tucumán, working in coordination with the national program on sexual health and responsible procreation to ensure the fulfillment of sexual and reproductive rights for the population. It is aimed at all residents of the province and is executed by the Ministry of Health of Tucumán.

The program's overarching goal is to guarantee sexual and reproductive rights, reduce maternal and perinatal mortality, and decrease perinatal morbidity.", 'The program focuses on providing theoretical and practical tools to the healthcare team at all levels of comprehensive sexual and reproductive health care. Programas: Programa Provincial de Prevención y Abordaje de Violencia
Descripcion:
El Programa Provincial de Prevención y Abordaje de Violencia, bajo la dirección de la Dra. Graciela Lavado y perteneciente a la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica y la Dirección General del Programa Integrado de Salud, está ubicado en 25 de mayo 90. Su contacto es el teléfono 0381 - 4844000, internos 504/505, y el correo electrónico mij_ssyr@msptucuman.gov.ar. El objetivo general del programa es reducir la tasa de suicidios en la Provincia de Tucumán.

Entre sus objetivos específicos se incluyen la elaboración de informes para trabajar con los principales factores desencadenantes de la conducta suicida, la capacitación y el seguimiento de casos compartidos con otros Ministerios, y la detección de emergencias sanitarias en las áreas operativas con más casos de suicidios consumados. Además, se realiza el informe de las autopsias psicológicas implementadas en los casos de suicidios consumados para detectar nexos epidemiológicos entre los casos, y se establecen normas de atención en los distintos niveles de resolución.

El programa abarca todo el territorio de la provincia de Tucumán y consiste en brindar capacitación sobre la problemática a los equipos de salud, además de elaborar informes para detectar emergencias sanitarias en las áreas operativas con más casos de suicidios consumados. La población destinataria incluye a todos los habitantes de la provincia, y el programa es ejecutado por el Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán.
Traduccion:
The Provincial Program for Prevention and Addressing Violence, under the direction of Dr. Graciela Lavado and belonging to the Executive Medical Secretary and the General Directorate of the Integrated Health Program, is located at 25 de Mayo 90. You can contact them at telephone number 0381-4844000, extensions 504/505, or via email at mij_ssyr@msptucuman.gov.ar. The general objective of the program is to reduce the suicide rate in the Province of Tucumán.

Among its specific objectives are the development of reports to address the main triggers of suicidal behavior, training and case monitoring in collaboration with other Ministries, and the detection of health emergencies in operational areas with higher rates of completed suicides. Additionally, psychological autopsies are conducted in cases of completed suicides to detect epidemiological links among cases, and care standards are established across different levels of healthcare facilities.

The program covers the entire territory of the province of Tucumán and involves providing training on the issue to healthcare teams, as well as developing reports to detect health emergencies in operational areas with higher rates of completed suicides. The target population includes all residents of the province, and the program is executed by the Ministry of Health of Tucumán.

Programas: Programa de Prevención de Enfermedades Cardiovasculares
Descripcion:
El Programa de Prevención de Enfermedades Cardiovasculares, liderado por la Dra. Graciela Lavado y ubicado bajo la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica y la Dirección General del Programa Integrado de Salud, se encuentra en 25 de mayo 90. Su contacto es el teléfono 0381 - 4844000, internos 504/505, y el correo electrónico mij_ssyr@msptucuman.gov.ar. El objetivo principal del programa es disminuir la morbimortalidad por factores de riesgo cardiovasculares en toda la provincia de Tucumán.

El programa se enfoca en la promoción, prevención y control de las enfermedades cardiovasculares, siguiendo el marco establecido por la Ley Nacional 25.501 sancionada en noviembre de 2001. La población destinataria incluye a todos los habitantes de la provincia, y el programa es ejecutado por el Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán.
Traduccion:
The Program for Prevention of Cardiovascular Diseases, led by Dr. Graciela Lavado and located under the Executive Medical Secretary and the General Directorate of the Integrated Health Program, is situated at 25 de Mayo 90. You can contact them at telephone number 0381-4844000, extensions 504/505, or via email at mij_ssyr@msptucuman.gov.ar. The main objective of the program is to reduce morbidity and mortality due to cardiovascular risk factors throughout the province of Tucumán.

The program focuses on the promotion, prevention, and control of cardiovascular diseases, following the framework established by National Law 25.501 enacted in November 2001. The target population includes all residents of the province, and the program is implemented by the Ministry of Health of Tucumán.

Programas: Programa Detección Precoz y Tratamiento de las Hipoacusias Neonatales
Descripcion:
El Programa de Detección Precoz y Tratamiento de las Hipoacusias Neonatales está dirigido por la Dra. Graciela Lavado, perteneciente a la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica y la Dirección General del Programa Integrado de Salud, con sede en 25 de mayo 90 y teléfono de contacto 0381 - 4844000 interno 504/505. Su objetivo general es lograr la integración de los niños con discapacidad auditiva en toda la provincia de Tucumán, asegurando el acceso oportuno al tamizaje auditivo neonatal y estableciendo un sistema de seguimiento para la rehabilitación y tratamiento temprano.

El programa se desarrolla en todo el territorio de Tucumán y está destinado a recién nacidos hasta los 2 años de edad. Los componentes del programa incluyen el análisis de factores de riesgo auditivo, tamizado auditivo universal perinatal por otoemisiones acústicas durante el primer mes de vida, diagnóstico auditivo antes del sexto mes (utilizando metodologías como PEAT, timpanometría y audiometría adaptada a la edad del paciente), y seguimiento de niños con factores de riesgo auditivo hasta el segundo año de vida. Además, se implementan procedimientos médicos y audiológicos necesarios, incluyendo la adaptación de dispositivos auditivos y la terapia auditiva correspondiente.

El programa también contempla la entrega y calibración de audífonos e implantes cocleares cuando es necesario. La modalidad de ejecución incluye pesquisa, detección, diagnóstico, seguimiento y terapéutica, asegurando una intervención integral y precoz para optimizar el desarrollo del lenguaje, la comunicación, y el rendimiento intelectual, emocional, social y escolar de los niños con hipoacusia. Este enfoque busca mitigar las limitaciones cognitivas y sociales derivadas de la pérdida auditiva, que puede tener graves repercusiones si no se abordan a tiempo.

El déficit auditivo puede dificultar la participación del niño en la sociedad y afectar su desarrollo integral. La hipoacusia congénita, en particular, puede alterar significativamente el desarrollo intelectual, académico y social del niño. Las áreas de reconocimiento del lenguaje se desarrollan antes de los tres años de edad, por lo que una audición normal en esta etapa es crucial. La máxima plasticidad para el reconocimiento de los códigos auditivos se alcanza durante el primer año de vida, disminuyendo progresivamente a partir de los tres años. Por tanto, la detección y tratamiento temprano de la hipoacusia son esenciales para el desarrollo completo del individuo y su integración en la sociedad.

Según la Organización Mundial de la Salud (OMS), la incidencia de hipoacusia severa o profunda en recién nacidos es de 1 por mil, aumentando a 3 por mil cuando se incluyen hipoacusias moderadas y a 5 por mil recién nacidos vivos considerando diferentes grados de hipoacusia. El programa, ejecutado por el Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán, busca reducir esta incidencia y mejorar la calidad de vida de los niños afectados y sus familias.
Traduccion:
The Early Detection and Treatment Program for Neonatal Hearing Loss, led by Dr. Graciela Lavado, under the Executive Medical Secretary and the General Directorate of the Integrated Health Program, is located at 25 de Mayo 90. You can contact them at telephone number 0381-4844000, extensions 504/505. The program's general objective is to integrate children with hearing disabilities throughout the province of Tucumán, ensuring timely access to neonatal hearing screening and establishing a follow-up system for rehabilitation and early treatment.

The program is implemented across the entire territory of Tucumán and targets newborns up to 2 years of age. Program components include the analysis of auditory risk factors, universal perinatal hearing screening using otoacoustic emissions during the first month of life, auditory diagnosis before the sixth month (using methodologies such as ABR, tympanometry, and age-appropriate audiometry), and follow-up for children with auditory risk factors until the second year of life. Additionally, necessary medical and audiologic procedures are implemented, including the fitting of hearing devices and corresponding auditory therapy.

The program also includes the provision and calibration of hearing aids and cochlear implants when necessary. The program's execution includes screening, detection, diagnosis, follow-up, and therapy, ensuring comprehensive and early intervention to optimize language development, communication, and intellectual, emotional, social, and academic performance of children with hearing loss. This approach aims to mitigate cognitive and social limitations resulting from hearing loss, which can have severe consequences if not addressed promptly.

Hearing impairment can hinder a child's participation in society and affect their overall development. Congenital hearing loss, in particular, can significantly alter a child's intellectual, academic, and social development. Language recognition areas develop before the age of three, making normal hearing crucial during this period. Maximum plasticity for auditory code recognition is achieved during the first year of life, gradually decreasing after three years. Therefore, early detection and treatment of hearing loss are essential for the complete development of individuals and their integration into society.

According to the World Health Organization (WHO), the incidence of severe or profound hearing loss in newborns is 1 per thousand, increasing to 3 per thousand when including moderate hearing loss, and 5 per thousand live births considering different degrees of hearing loss. The program, executed by the Ministry of Health of Tucumán, aims to reduce this incidence and improve the quality of life for affected children and their families.
Programas_en _ingles: Early Detection and Treatment of Neonatal Hypoacusias Program

Language recognition areas develop before the age of three, making normal hearing crucial during this period. Maximum plasticity for auditory code recognition is achieved during the first year of life, gradually decreasing after three years. Therefore, early detection and treatment of hearing loss are essential for the complete development of individuals and their integration into society.", 'According to the World Health Organization (WHO), the incidence of severe or profound hearing loss in newborns is 1 per thousand, increasing to 3 per thousand when including moderate hearing loss, and 5 per thousand live births considering different degrees of hearing loss. The program, executed by the Ministry of Health of Tucumán, aims to reduce this incidence and improve the quality of life for affected children and their families.']

Programas: Programa de Salud Integral del Adolescente
Descripcion:
El Programa de Salud Integral del Adolescente, dirigido por la Dra. Graciela Lavado y perteneciente a la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica, tiene como objetivo implementar un marco programático que coordine e impulse acciones integrales en salud para la población adolescente en toda la provincia de Tucumán. Se propone articular esfuerzos integrales y compartidos, desarrollando políticas públicas en acciones de salud que impacten positivamente en los adolescentes. La población destinataria abarca a todos los adolescentes de la provincia, y el programa es ejecutado por el Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán.

La salud integral del adolescente se concibe como su bienestar físico, mental y social, incluyendo aspectos relacionados con su desarrollo educativo, la participación en actividades comunitarias y el desarrollo de su máximo potencial.
Traduccion:
The Comprehensive Adolescent Health Program, led by Dr. Graciela Lavado and under the Executive Medical Secretary, aims to implement a programmatic framework that coordinates and promotes comprehensive health actions for the adolescent population throughout the province of Tucumán. It seeks to coordinate comprehensive and shared efforts, developing public policies in health actions that positively impact adolescents. The target population includes all adolescents in the province, and the program is executed by the Ministry of Health of Tucumán.

Comprehensive adolescent health is conceptualized as their physical, mental, and social well-being, including aspects related to their educational development, participation in community activities, and the realization of their full potential.
Parrafos: ['The Comprehensive Adolescent Health Program, led by Dr. Graciela Lavado and under the Executive Medical Secretary, aims to implement a programmatic framework that coordinates and promotes comprehensive health actions for the adolescent population throughout the province of Tucumán. It seeks to coordinate comprehensive and shared efforts, developing public policies in health actions that positively impact adolescents. The target population includes all adolescents in the province, and the program is executed by the Ministry of Health of Tucumán.', 'Comprehensive adolescent health is conceptualized as their physical, mental, and social well-being, including aspects related to their educational development, participation in community activities, and the realization of their full potential.']

Descripcion:
El Programa Perinatal, liderado por la Dra. Graciela Lavado y perteneciente a la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica, tiene como objetivo principal disminuir las probabilidades de enfermedad o muerte de las mujeres durante el embarazo, parto y puerperio, así como de sus hijos durante el período fetal y neonatal en toda la provincia de Tucumán. Entre sus objetivos específicos se encuentran fortalecer la atención preconcepcional, incentivar el control prenatal oportuno, mejorar la atención del parto y puerperio en maternidades seguras centradas en la familia, y brindar consejería en anticoncepción para reducir embarazos no intencionales.

El programa se enfoca en mejorar la calidad y cobertura de la atención perinatal, involucrando al personal de salud encargado de la promoción, prevención y atención de mujeres en edad fértil, embarazadas y puérperas del sistema de salud provincial. Se implementa en toda la comunidad hospitalaria, promoviendo la concienciación sobre la importancia de ser un Hospital Amigo de la Madre y el Niño. Además, se desarrollan actividades en escuelas secundarias, operativos de salud en comunidades específicas y en los diferentes niveles de atención de salud, incluyendo maternidades centradas en la familia, hospitales de segundo nivel y Centros de Atención Primaria de la Salud (CAPS).

La población destinataria del programa son todas las mujeres embarazadas en la provincia de Tucumán. La ejecución del programa recae en el Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán, que coordina las acciones necesarias para garantizar la atención integral y de calidad durante el período perinatal.
Traduccion:
The Perinatal Program, led by Dr. Graciela Lavado and under the Executive Medical Secretary, aims to significantly reduce the likelihood of disease or death among women during pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period, as well as among their children during the fetal and neonatal periods throughout the province of Tucumán. Among its specific objectives are to strengthen preconception care, encourage timely prenatal care, improve childbirth and postpartum care in family-centered safe maternity settings, and provide contraception counseling to reduce unintended pregnancies.

The program focuses on enhancing the quality and coverage of perinatal care, involving health personnel responsible for promoting, preventing, and caring for women of childbearing age, pregnant women, and postpartum women within the provincial health system. It is implemented across the entire hospital community, promoting awareness of the importance of being a Mother and Child Friendly Hospital. Additionally, activities are conducted in secondary schools, health campaigns in specific communities, and across different levels of health care facilities, including family-centered maternity hospitals, secondary-level hospitals, and Primary Health Care Centers (CAPS).

The target population of the program includes all pregnant women in the province of Tucumán. The execution of the program is overseen by the Ministry of Health of Tucumán, which coordinates necessary actions to ensure comprehensive and quality care during the perinatal period.
Parrafos: ['The Perinatal Program, led by Dr. Graciela Lavado and under the Executive Medical Secretary, aims to significantly reduce the likelihood of disease or death among women during pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period, as well as among their children during the fetal and neonatal periods throughout the province of Tucumán. Among its specific objectives are to strengthen preconception care, encourage timely prenatal care, improve childbirth and postpartum care in family-centered safe maternity settings, and provide contraception counseling to reduce unintended pregnancies.', 'The program focuses on enhancing the quality and coverage of perinatal care, involving health personnel responsible for promoting, preventing, and caring for women of childbearing age, pregnant women, and postpartum women within the provincial health system. It is implemented across the entire hospital community, promoting awareness of the importance of being a Mother and Child Friendly Hospital. Additionally, activities are conducted in secondary schools, health campaigns in specific communities, and across different levels of health care facilities, including family-centered maternity hospitals, secondary-level hospitals, and Primary Health Care Centers (CAPS).', 'The target population of the program includes all pregnant women in the province of Tucumán. The execution of the program is overseen by the Ministry of Health of Tucumán, which coordinates necessary actions to ensure comprehensive and quality care during the perinatal period.']

Descripcion:
El Programa de Control de Leishmaniasis, dirigido por la Dra. Graciela Lavado y perteneciente a la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica, tiene como objetivo general desarrollar un sistema para el diagnóstico precoz y tratamiento oportuno de personas infectadas con parásitos del género Leishmania en toda la provincia de Tucumán. Sus objetivos específicos incluyen registrar los estudios por laboratorio de todas las formas de Leishmaniasis en humanos, así como la confirmación de casos, y alertar de forma temprana ante la ocurrencia de casos de Leishmaniasis canina, registrando la información necesaria para realizar acciones de control.

El programa abarca actividades de promoción, prevención, diagnóstico y tratamiento de las diferentes formas de Leishmaniasis (cutánea, mucosa y visceral). Su población destinataria son todos los habitantes de la provincia de Tucumán. La ejecución del programa recae en el Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán, que coordina las acciones necesarias para llevar a cabo las actividades de control de esta enfermedad.
Traduccion:
The Leishmaniasis Control Program, led by Dr. Graciela Lavado and under the Executive Medical Secretary, aims to develop a system for early diagnosis and timely treatment of individuals infected with parasites of the genus Leishmania throughout the province of Tucumán. Its specific objectives include recording laboratory studies of all forms of Leishmaniasis in humans, confirming cases, and early alerting to the occurrence of canine Leishmaniasis, registering necessary information for control actions.

The program encompasses activities for promotion, prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of different forms of Leishmaniasis (cutaneous, mucosal, and visceral). Its target population includes all residents of the province of Tucumán. The Ministry of Health of Tucumán is responsible for executing the program, coordinating necessary actions to carry out disease control activities effectively.
Parrafos: ['The Leishmaniasis Control Program, led by Dr. Graciela Lavado and under the Executive Medical Secretary, aims to develop a system for early diagnosis and timely treatment of individuals infected with parasites of the genus Leishmania throughout the province of Tucumán. Its specific objectives include recording laboratory studies of all forms of Leishmaniasis in humans, confirming cases, and early alerting to the occurrence of canine Leishmaniasis, registering necessary information for control actions.', 'The program encompasses activities for promotion, prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of different forms of Leishmaniasis (cutaneous, mucosal, and visceral). Its target population includes all residents of the province of Tucumán. The Ministry of Health of Tucumán is responsible for executing the program, coordinating necessary actions to carry out disease control activities effectively.']

Descripcion:
El Programa de Control de Chagas, bajo la dirección de la Dra. Graciela Lavado y administrado por la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica, tiene como objetivo general disminuir la morbimortalidad asociada a la infección por Trypanosoma cruzi en la provincia de Tucumán. Sus objetivos específicos incluyen implementar la vigilancia de la transmisión vectorial y no vectorial de la enfermedad.

El programa se enfoca en disminuir la infección por Trypanosoma cruzi en toda la provincia, especialmente en viviendas ubicadas en zonas endémicas. Para lograrlo, se busca optimizar el control de la transmisión congénita y desarrollar un sistema de diagnóstico precoz y tratamiento oportuno para las personas infectadas.

La población destinataria del programa son todos los habitantes de la provincia de Tucumán que se encuentran en zonas de riesgo de infección por Chagas. La ejecución del programa es responsabilidad del Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán, que coordina las acciones necesarias para llevar a cabo el control de esta enfermedad en toda la provincia.
Traduccion:
The Chagas Disease Control Program, under the direction of Dr. Graciela Lavado and managed by the Executive Medical Secretary, aims to reduce the morbidity and mortality associated with Trypanosoma cruzi infection in the province of Tucumán. Its specific objectives include implementing surveillance of both vectorial and non-vectorial transmission of the disease.

The program focuses on reducing Trypanosoma cruzi infection across the entire province, especially in households located in endemic areas. To achieve this, efforts are aimed at optimizing control of congenital transmission and developing a system for early diagnosis and timely treatment of infected individuals.

The target population of the program includes all residents of the province of Tucumán who are at risk of Chagas infection. The execution of the program is the responsibility of the Ministry of Health of Tucumán, which coordinates necessary actions to effectively control this disease throughout the province.
Parrafos: ['The Chagas Disease Control Program, under the direction of Dr. Graciela Lavado and managed by the Executive Medical Secretary, aims to reduce the morbidity and mortality associated with Trypanosoma cruzi infection in the province of Tucumán. Its specific objectives include implementing surveillance of both vectorial and non-vectorial transmission of the disease.', 'The program focuses on reducing Trypanosoma cruzi infection across the entire province, especially in households located in endemic areas. To achieve this, efforts are aimed at optimizing control of congenital transmission and developing a system for early diagnosis and timely treatment of infected individuals.', 'The target population of the program includes all residents of the province of Tucumán who are at risk of Chagas infection. The execution of the program is the responsibility of the Ministry of Health of Tucumán, which coordinates necessary actions to effectively control this disease throughout the province.']

Programas: Programa de Educacion Alimentaria Nutricional Tucumán (Peant)
Descripcion:
El Programa de Educación Alimentaria Nutricional de Tucumán (PEANT), dirigido por la Dra. Graciela Lavado y gestionado por la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica, tiene como objetivo general desarrollar la capacidad de identificar problemas alimentarios nutricionales y tomar medidas para mejorarlos a nivel personal, familiar y comunitario. Sus objetivos específicos incluyen promover una vida saludable, mejorar las condiciones alimentarias y nutricionales, aprovechar mejor los recursos destinados a la alimentación familiar, fortalecer la articulación entre instituciones y revalorizar la cultura alimentaria.

El programa se implementa en todo el territorio de la provincia de Tucumán y consta de la formación de multiplicadores en educación alimentaria nutricional a través de cursos teórico-prácticos de 40 horas. Estos cursos están dirigidos al equipo de salud, docentes y al público en general. Se busca mejorar la alimentación y nutrición de toda la población, considerando un proceso dinámico en el que se adquieren, reafirman y cambian conocimientos, actitudes, habilidades y prácticas relacionadas con la producción, selección, adquisición, conservación, preparación y consumo de alimentos.

La población destinataria del programa son todos los habitantes de la provincia de Tucumán. La ejecución del programa recae en el Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán, que coordina las acciones necesarias para llevar a cabo la formación de multiplicadores y la implementación de intervenciones para mejorar la alimentación y nutrición en la comunidad.
Traduccion:
The Nutritional Food Education Program of Tucumán (PEANT), directed by Dr. Graciela Lavado and managed by the Executive Medical Secretariat, has the general objective of developing the capacity to identify nutritional food problems and take measures to improve them at personal, family, and community levels. Its specific objectives include promoting a healthy life, improving food and nutritional conditions, making better use of resources allocated to family nutrition, strengthening the articulation between institutions, and valuing food culture.

The program is implemented throughout the territory of the province of Tucumán and consists of training multipliers in nutritional food education through 40-hour theoretical-practical courses. These courses are aimed at health teams, teachers, and the general public. The goal is to improve the nutrition and diet of the entire population, considering a dynamic process in which knowledge, attitudes, skills, and practices related to the production, selection, acquisition, conservation, preparation, and consumption of food are acquired, reaffirmed, and changed.

The target population of the program is all inhabitants of the province of Tucumán. The execution of the program falls to the Ministry of Health of Tucumán, which coordinates the necessary actions to carry out the training of multipliers and the implementation of interventions to improve food and nutrition in the community.
Parrafos: ['The Nutritional Food Education Program of Tucumán (PEANT), directed by Dr. Graciela Lavado and managed by the Executive Medical Secretariat, has the general objective of developing the capacity to identify nutritional food problems and take measures to improve them at personal, family, and community levels. Its specific objectives include promoting a healthy life, improving food and nutritional conditions, making better use of resources allocated to family nutrition, strengthening the articulation between institutions, and valuing food culture.', 'The program is implemented throughout the territory of the province of Tucumán and consists of training multipliers in nutritional food education through 40-hour theoretical-practical courses. These courses are aimed at health teams, teachers, and the general public. The goal is to improve the nutrition and diet of the entire population, considering a dynamic process in which knowledge, attitudes, skills, and practices related to the production, selection, acquisition, conservation, preparation, and consumption of food are acquired, reaffirmed, and changed.', 'The target population of the program is all inhabitants of the province of Tucumán. The execution of the program falls to the Ministry of Health of Tucumán, which coordinates the necessary actions to carry out the training of multipliers and the implementation of interventions to improve food and nutrition in the community.']

Programas: Programa de Capacitación de la Comunidad Para Asistencia en Paro Cardio Respiratorio
Descripcion:
El Programa de Capacitación de la Comunidad para Asistencia en Paro Cardiorespiratorio, dirigido por el Dr. Miguel Ferre Contreras y gestionado por el SIPROSA (Sistema Provincial de Salud), tiene como objetivo general capacitar y entrenar a personas de la comunidad en maniobras básicas de reanimación cardiopulmonar (RCP).

Este programa se implementa en todo el territorio de la provincia de Tucumán y consiste en entrenar y capacitar a la población en general para reconocer los síntomas de ataques cardiopulmonares, comenzar su tratamiento y activar el sistema de emergencias médicas cuando sea necesario.

La población destinataria del programa son todos los habitantes de la provincia de Tucumán. El Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán es el organismo responsable de la ejecución del programa, coordinando las actividades necesarias para llevar a cabo la capacitación y entrenamiento de la comunidad en maniobras básicas de RCP.
Traduccion:
The Community Training Program for Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Assistance, directed by Dr. Miguel Ferre Contreras and managed by SIPROSA (Provincial Health System), has the general objective of training and educating community members in basic cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) techniques.

This program is implemented throughout the territory of the province of Tucumán and involves training and educating the general population to recognize the symptoms of cardiopulmonary attacks, initiate treatment, and activate the medical emergency system when necessary.

The target population of the program is all inhabitants of the province of Tucumán. The Ministry of Health of Tucumán is the agency responsible for executing the program, coordinating the necessary activities to carry out the community training and education in basic CPR techniques.
Programas_en _ingles: Community Training Programme for Assistance in Respiratory Cardio
Parrafos: ['The Community Training Program for Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Assistance, directed by Dr. Miguel Ferre Contreras and managed by SIPROSA (Provincial Health System), has the general objective of training and educating community members in basic cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) techniques.', 'This program is implemented throughout the territory of the province of Tucumán and involves training and educating the general population to recognize the symptoms of cardiopulmonary attacks, initiate treatment, and activate the medical emergency system when necessary.', 'The target population of the program is all inhabitants of the province of Tucumán. The Ministry of Health of Tucumán is the agency responsible for executing the program, coordinating the necessary activities to carry out the community training and education in basic CPR techniques.']

Descripcion:
El Programa de Abordaje Nutricional (PAN), bajo la dirección de la Dra. Graciela Lavado y la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica, tiene como objetivo general brindar atención integral a las familias en riesgo socio nutricional en toda la provincia de Tucumán. El programa busca asegurar una alimentación adecuada y promover el desarrollo y crecimiento infantil.

Se implementa en todo el territorio provincial y se centra en el cuidado integral de familias en situación de riesgo socio nutricional. Esto se logra mediante el seguimiento del estado nutricional y la recuperación de niños, niñas, adolescentes menores de 15 años y embarazadas. El PAN se divide en dos componentes principales: el Focalizado de Rehabilitación Nutricional, a cargo del Ministerio de Salud Pública, y Familias Críticas, bajo la administración del Ministerio de Desarrollo Social.

El Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán es el organismo responsable de la ejecución del programa, supervisando el control y seguimiento de la salud de los destinatarios del PAN. La población destinataria del programa son las familias en riesgo socio nutricional, quienes reciben atención especializada para mejorar sus condiciones alimentarias y nutricionales, asegurando así un desarrollo saludable, especialmente en niños, niñas y embarazadas.
Traduccion:
The Nutritional Approach Program (PAN), under the direction of Dr. Graciela Lavado and the Executive Medical Secretariat, aims to provide comprehensive care to families at nutritional risk throughout the province of Tucumán. The program seeks to ensure adequate nutrition and promote the development and growth of children.

Implemented across the entire provincial territory, PAN focuses on the comprehensive care of families in situations of socio-nutritional risk. This is achieved through monitoring the nutritional status and recovery of children, adolescents under 15 years old, and pregnant women. PAN is divided into two main components: Nutritional Rehabilitation, managed by the Ministry of Public Health, and Critical Families, administered by the Ministry of Social Development.

The Ministry of Health of Tucumán is responsible for executing the program, overseeing the health monitoring and follow-up of PAN recipients. The target population of the program includes families at socio-nutritional risk, who receive specialized care to improve their nutritional and dietary conditions, ensuring healthy development, particularly in children and pregnant women.

The program seeks to ensure adequate nutrition and promote the development and growth of children.', 'Implemented across the entire provincial territory, PAN focuses on the comprehensive care of families in situations of socio-nutritional risk. This is achieved through monitoring the nutritional status and recovery of children, adolescents under 15 years old, and pregnant women. PAN is divided into two main components: Nutritional Rehabilitation, managed by the Ministry of Public Health, and Critical Families, administered by the Ministry of Social Development.', 'The Ministry of Health of Tucumán is responsible for executing the program, overseeing the health monitoring and follow-up of PAN recipients. The target population of the program includes families at socio-nutritional risk, who receive specialized care to improve their nutritional and dietary conditions, ensuring healthy development, particularly in children and pregnant women.']

Descripcion:
El Programa Ampliado de Inmunizaciones (PAI), dirigido por la Dra. Graciela Lavado y bajo la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica, tiene como objetivo general alcanzar y mantener una cobertura de vacunación del 95% en cada área de responsabilidad de los Centros de Salud de toda la provincia de Tucumán, para cada vacuna de importancia en salud pública.

Para lograr este objetivo, el programa se enfoca en mantener la eliminación de enfermedades como la poliomielitis, el sarampión, la rubéola y el síndrome de rubéola congénita, además de controlar otras enfermedades inmunoprevenibles. Se implementan políticas que aseguren la disponibilidad de insumos y la accesibilidad a las vacunas en toda la provincia, siguiendo las directrices establecidas por la Ley 22.909, que considera la vacunación como un derecho de toda la población y un deber del Estado garantizar este derecho.

El PAI abarca a todos los habitantes de la provincia de Tucumán, con la finalidad de proteger la salud pública y prevenir la propagación de enfermedades infecciosas. El Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán es el organismo responsable de la ejecución y seguimiento del programa, asegurando la cobertura de vacunación en todos los centros de salud de la provincia.
Traduccion:
The Expanded Program on Immunization (PAI), directed by Dr. Graciela Lavado and under the Executive Medical Secretariat, has the general objective of achieving and maintaining a 95% vaccination coverage in each responsibility area of the Health Centers throughout the province of Tucumán for each vaccine of public health importance.

To achieve this objective, the program focuses on maintaining the elimination of diseases such as poliomyelitis, measles, rubella, and congenital rubella syndrome, as well as controlling other vaccine-preventable diseases. Policies are implemented to ensure the availability of supplies and access to vaccines throughout the province, following the guidelines established by Law 22.909, which considers vaccination a right of the entire population and a duty of the State to guarantee this right.

The PAI covers all inhabitants of the province of Tucumán, aiming to protect public health and prevent the spread of infectious diseases. The Ministry of Health of Tucumán is responsible for executing and monitoring the program, ensuring vaccination coverage in all health centers in the province.
Parrafos: ['The Expanded Program on Immunization (PAI), directed by Dr. Graciela Lavado and under the Executive Medical Secretariat, has the general objective of achieving and maintaining a 95% vaccination coverage in each responsibility area of the Health Centers throughout the province of Tucumán for each vaccine of public health importance.', 'To achieve this objective, the program focuses on maintaining the elimination of diseases such as poliomyelitis, measles, rubella, and congenital rubella syndrome, as well as controlling other vaccine-preventable diseases. Policies are implemented to ensure the availability of supplies and access to vaccines throughout the province, following the guidelines established by Law 22.909, which considers vaccination a right of the entire population and a duty of the State to guarantee this right.', 'The PAI covers all inhabitants of the province of Tucumán, aiming to protect public health and prevent the spread of infectious diseases. The Ministry of Health of Tucumán is responsible for executing and monitoring the program, ensuring vaccination coverage in all health centers in the province.']

Descripcion:
El Programa Provincial de Enfermedad Celíaca, dirigido por la Dra. Graciela Lavado y bajo la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica, tiene como objetivo general diagnosticar y brindar atención a pacientes celíacos en toda la provincia de Tucumán.

Para lograr este objetivo, el programa se enfoca en realizar actividades de promoción, asesoramiento técnico, capacitación a los equipos de salud y educación alimentaria para los pacientes. Además, se busca llevar a cabo la informatización y nominalización de los pacientes en el programa, junto con la implementación de una chequera de prestaciones médicas, laboratoriales y nutricionales.

El programa opera en todo el territorio de la provincia de Tucumán y consiste en acciones específicas para el diagnóstico y atención de pacientes celíacos. Se busca organizar y capacitar a toda la red asistencial pública en la detección y tratamiento de esta enfermedad, en coordinación con otros subsectores de salud.

La población destinataria del programa son todos los pacientes celíacos de la provincia de Tucumán, con el objetivo de proporcionarles una atención integral y mejorar su calidad de vida. El Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán es el organismo responsable de la ejecución y coordinación de este programa.
Traduccion:
The Provincial Celiac Disease Program, directed by Dr. Graciela Lavado and under the Executive Medical Secretariat, has the general objective of diagnosing and providing care to celiac patients throughout the province of Tucumán.

To achieve this objective, the program focuses on promoting activities, providing technical advice, training health teams, and offering nutritional education to patients. Additionally, it aims to computerize and register patients in the program, along with implementing a voucher system for medical, laboratory, and nutritional services.

The program operates throughout the entire province of Tucumán and consists of specific actions for the diagnosis and care of celiac patients. It seeks to organize and train the entire public healthcare network in the detection and treatment of this disease, in coordination with other health sub-sectors.
Parrafos: ['The Provincial Celiac Disease Program, directed by Dr. Graciela Lavado and under the Executive Medical Secretariat, has the general objective of diagnosing and providing care to celiac patients throughout the province of Tucumán.', 'To achieve this objective, the program focuses on promoting activities, providing technical advice, training health teams, and offering nutritional education to patients. Additionally, it aims to computerize and register patients in the program, along with implementing a voucher system for medical, laboratory, and nutritional services.', 'The program operates throughout the entire province of Tucumán and consists of specific actions for the diagnosis and care of celiac patients. It seeks to organize and train the entire public healthcare network in the detection and treatment of this disease, in coordination with other health sub-sectors.']

Descripcion:
El Programa de Lactancia Materna, dirigido por la Dra. Graciela Lavado y bajo la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica, tiene como objetivo general generar acciones de salud pública para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de supervivencia de los niños y niñas en la etapa más vulnerable de sus vidas (0 a 6 meses). Esto se logra promoviendo la salud a largo plazo hasta la edad adulta.

Los objetivos específicos del programa incluyen garantizar que los niños de 0 a 6 meses reciban lactancia materna exclusiva, lo que contribuye a reducir la mortalidad infantil y disminuir las enfermedades prevalentes en la infancia.

Este programa se implementa en todo el territorio de la provincia de Tucumán y comprende acciones de difusión, promoción y educación sobre los beneficios de la lactancia materna exclusiva desde el nacimiento hasta los 6 meses de vida. Además, se fomenta la incorporación de alimentación complementaria de manera oportuna y el destete.

El Programa de Lactancia Materna fue creado a nivel provincial en el año 2008, siguiendo los lineamientos del Ministerio de Salud de la Nación, la Organización Mundial de la Salud (OMS) y UNICEF.

La población destinataria del programa son todos los niños de 0 a 6 meses de la Provincia de Tucumán, con el objetivo de garantizar su salud y bienestar desde las primeras etapas de la vida. El Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán es el organismo responsable de la ejecución y coordinación de este programa.
Traduccion:
The Breastfeeding Program, directed by Dr. Graciela Lavado and under the Executive Medical Secretariat, has the general objective of generating public health actions to meet the basic survival needs of children in the most vulnerable stage of their lives (0 to 6 months). This is achieved by promoting long-term health into adulthood.

The specific objectives of the program include ensuring that children from 0 to 6 months receive exclusive breastfeeding, which helps reduce infant mortality and decrease prevalent childhood diseases.

This program is implemented throughout the province of Tucumán and includes actions for disseminating, promoting, and educating about the benefits of exclusive breastfeeding from birth to 6 months of age. Additionally, it encourages the timely introduction of complementary feeding and weaning.

The Breastfeeding Program was created at the provincial level in 2008, following the guidelines of the National Ministry of Health, the World Health Organization (WHO), and UNICEF.

The target population of the program includes all children from 0 to 6 months in the province of Tucumán, aiming to ensure their health and well-being from the early stages of life. The Ministry of Health of Tucumán is responsible for executing and coordinating this program.
Parrafos: ['The Breastfeeding Program, directed by Dr. Graciela Lavado and under the Executive Medical Secretariat, has the general objective of generating public health actions to meet the basic survival needs of children in the most vulnerable stage of their lives (0 to 6 months). This is achieved by promoting long-term health into adulthood.', 'The specific objectives of the program include ensuring that children from 0 to 6 months receive exclusive breastfeeding, which helps reduce infant mortality and decrease prevalent childhood diseases.', 'This program is implemented throughout the province of Tucumán and includes actions for disseminating, promoting, and educating about the benefits of exclusive breastfeeding from birth to 6 months of age. Additionally, it encourages the timely introduction of complementary feeding and weaning.', 'The Breastfeeding Program was created at the provincial level in 2008, following the guidelines of the National Ministry of Health, the World Health Organization (WHO), and UNICEF.', 'The target population of the program includes all children from 0 to 6 months in the province of Tucumán, aiming to ensure their health and well-being from the early stages of life. The Ministry of Health of Tucumán is responsible for executing and coordinating this program.']

Descripcion:
El Programa de Salud Bucal, dirigido por la Dra. Graciela Lavado bajo la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica, tiene como objetivo general contribuir a la promoción, prevención y atención de la salud bucal de los alumnos de establecimientos públicos de nivel primario en toda la provincia de Tucumán.

Los objetivos específicos del programa incluyen determinar índices epidemiológicos como el CPOD y CEOD (índices significativos de caries dental) para evaluar la salud bucal de la población objetivo.

Las actividades del programa comprenden la promoción de la salud bucal, la prevención de enfermedades dentales, la determinación de índices epidemiológicos y la incorporación de los niños al plan de tratamiento y atención odontológica, con el objetivo de lograr altas básicas o integrales.

La población destinataria del programa son todos los alumnos de establecimientos públicos de nivel primario en la provincia de Tucumán, con el fin de garantizar su salud bucal y prevenir enfermedades dentales. El Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán es el organismo responsable de la ejecución y coordinación de este programa.
Traduccion:
The Oral Health Program, directed by Dr. Graciela Lavado under the Executive Medical Secretariat, has the general objective of contributing to the promotion, prevention, and care of the oral health of students in public primary schools throughout the province of Tucumán.

The specific objectives of the program include determining epidemiological indices such as CPOD and CEOD (significant dental caries indices) to evaluate the oral health of the target population.

The activities of the program include promoting oral health, preventing dental diseases, determining epidemiological indices, and incorporating children into the dental treatment and care plan, with the goal of achieving basic or comprehensive discharges.

The target population of the program includes all students in public primary schools in the province of Tucumán, aiming to ensure their oral health and prevent dental diseases. The Ministry of Health of Tucumán is responsible for executing and coordinating this program.
Parrafos: ['The Oral Health Program, directed by Dr. Graciela Lavado under the Executive Medical Secretariat, has the general objective of contributing to the promotion, prevention, and care of the oral health of students in public primary schools throughout the province of Tucumán.', 'The specific objectives of the program include determining epidemiological indices such as CPOD and CEOD (significant dental caries indices) to evaluate the oral health of the target population.', 'The activities of the program include promoting oral health, preventing dental diseases, determining epidemiological indices, and incorporating children into the dental treatment and care plan, with the goal of achieving basic or comprehensive discharges.', 'The target population of the program includes all students in public primary schools in the province of Tucumán, aiming to ensure their oral health and prevent dental diseases. The Ministry of Health of Tucumán is responsible for executing and coordinating this program.']

Programas: Programa de Salud en Dispositivos de Cuidados Institucionales
Descripcion:
El Programa de Salud en Dispositivos de Cuidados Institucionales, dirigido por la Dra. Graciela Lavado bajo la Secretaría Ejecutiva Médica, tiene como objetivo general fortalecer el ingreso bajo el programa de aquellos que poseen patologías crónicas y gestionar la provisión de medicamentos e insumos mediante botiquines y en los dispositivos de cuidados institucionales de toda la provincia de Tucumán.

Los componentes y prestaciones del programa incluyen promover y gestionar el acceso a los servicios de salud para ofrecer cobertura médica a los niños, niñas y adolescentes institucionalizados transitoriamente, fortalecer y actualizar conocimientos a través de la capacitación permanente del personal a cargo de los cuidados parentales transitorios, y articular acciones de promoción y prevención en salud para reducir la morbilidad de la población objetivo.

La población destinataria del programa son los niños, niñas y adolescentes institucionalizados transitoriamente, que no cuentan con cobertura médica bajo el sistema público de salud en toda la provincia de Tucumán. El Ministerio de Salud de Tucumán es el organismo responsable de la ejecución y coordinación de este programa.
Traduccion:
The Health Program in Institutional Care Facilities, directed by Dr. Graciela Lavado under the Executive Medical Secretariat, has the general objective of strengthening the admission of those with chronic conditions under the program and managing the provision of medications and supplies through kits and in the institutional care facilities throughout the province of Tucumán.

The components and services of the program include promoting and managing access to health services to provide medical coverage to temporarily institutionalized children and adolescents, strengthening and updating knowledge through the continuous training of staff in charge of temporary parental care, and coordinating health promotion and prevention actions to reduce morbidity in the target population.

The target population of the program includes temporarily institutionalized children and adolescents who do not have medical coverage under the public health system throughout the province of Tucumán. The Ministry of Health of Tucumán is responsible for executing and coordinating this program.
